Parameters: The ID for the service to stop being discovered.

Metadata used to describe this application which can be used to prompt the user to launch or install the application. If null, only applications looking for the specified service ID will be able to discover this endpoint.

The duration of the advertisement in milliseconds, unless @B_com#google#android#gms#nearby#connection#Connections#stopAdvertising_E@ is called first. If @B_com#google#android#gms#nearby#connection#Connections#DURATION_INDEFINITE_E@ is passed in, the advertisement will continue indefinitely until @B_com#google#android#gms#nearby#connection#Connections#stopAdvertising_E@ is called.
A listener notified when remote endpoints request a connection to this endpoint.

If @B_com#google#android#gms#nearby#connection#Connections#DURATION_INDEFINITE_E@ is passed in, discovery will continue indefinitely until @B_com#google#android#gms#nearby#connection#Connections#stopDiscovery_E@ is called.
A listener notified when a remote endpoint is discovered.
startDiscovery(com.google.android.gms.co.Description: Starts discovery for remote endpoints with the specified service ID. Possible result status codes include: @B_com#google#android#gms#nearby#connection#ConnectionsStatusCodes#STATUS_OK_E@ if discovery started successfully. @B_com#google#android#gms#nearby#connection#ConnectionsStatusCodes#STATUS_NETWORK_NOT_CONNECTED_E@ if the device is not connected to a network. @B_com#google#android#gms#nearby#connection#ConnectionsStatusCodes#STATUS_ALREADY_DISCOVERING_E@ if the app is already discovering the specified service. Required API: @B_com#google#android#gms#nearby#Nearby#CONNECTIONS_API_E@ Required Scopes: None

ClassDesc: Entry point for advertising and discovering nearby apps and services, and communicating with them over established connections.
